pages.text: $(item)Rhodonite Crystals$() are very volatile and reactive, meaning they will $(thing)corrupt$() most blocks it comes into contact with. Sometimes it will be too weak and require multiple $(item)Crystals$(), other times it will be too strong and require more of the original material. In cases of complete balance, only one of each material is required.

Somehow, $(thing)corrupting$() a piece of $(item)Redstone Dust$() seems to keep the redstone capability while creating an infinite output. $(br)Sadly while trying to revert the corruption, we discovered that the only working method was to remove the $(item)Redstone Dust$(), destroying it in the process and making the $(item)Rhodonite Dust$() collapse back into its original form.
